description: Verification endpoint /api/verify/scrape-source returns source='real_scrape' confirming no mock data
steps: Step 1: Start the backend server on port 3001
Step 2: Make GET request to /api/verify/scrape-source
Step 3: Verify response contains 'source' field with value 'real_scrape'
Step 4: Verify response contains 'scrape_age_minutes' field with numeric value
Step 5: Verify response contains 'sample_event' object with event details
Step 6: Verify sample_event contains 'source_url' starting with 'https://www.betfair.com'
Step 7: Verify sample_event contains 'scraped_at' timestamp
Step 8: Verify scrape_age_minutes is less than 30

description: Verification endpoint /api/verify/ai-status returns connected status with Claude model
steps: Step 1: Start the backend server on port 3001
Step 2: Ensure ANTHROPIC_API_KEY environment variable is set
Step 3: Make GET request to /api/verify/ai-status
Step 4: Verify response contains 'status' field with value 'connected'
Step 5: Verify response contains 'model' field starting with 'claude-'
Step 6: Verify response contains 'api_key_present' field with value true

description: Verification endpoint /api/verify/data-freshness confirms data is recent
steps: Step 1: Start the backend server on port 3001
Step 2: Trigger a scrape to ensure fresh data
Step 3: Make GET request to /api/verify/data-freshness
Step 4: Verify response contains 'is_fresh' field with value true
Step 5: Verify response contains 'newest_event_age_minutes' less than 30
Step 6: Verify response contains 'events_total' greater than 0

description: AI status endpoint returns error when API key is missing
steps: Step 1: Start backend server WITHOUT ANTHROPIC_API_KEY environment variable
Step 2: Make GET request to /api/verify/ai-status
Step 3: Verify response contains 'status' field with value 'error' or 'disconnected'
Step 4: Verify response contains 'api_key_present' field with value false

description: Scraper extracts real football data from Betfair using Playwright
steps: Step 1: Ensure Playwright is installed with Chromium browser
Step 2: Trigger scrape for football sport
Step 3: Verify scraper navigates to https://www.betfair.com/sport/football
Step 4: Verify scraper dismisses cookie consent popup
Step 5: Verify scraper uses page.evaluate() for DOM extraction
Step 6: Verify extracted events have 'scraped_at' timestamp
Step 7: Verify extracted events have 'source_url' field
Step 8: Verify database records have 'data_source' = 'real_scrape'
Step 9: Verify at least 1 event is extracted
Step 10: Verify odds are in correct decimal format

Step 10: Verify odds are extracted in fractional and decimal formats

description: No mock data generation code exists in scraper files
steps: Step 1: Search all Python files in backend/scraper for 'mock'
Step 2: Search all Python files in backend/scraper for 'fake'
Step 3: Search all Python files in backend/scraper for 'random'
Step 4: Search for functions named 'generate' followed by 'mock' or 'fake'
Step 5: Verify no matches found for any of the above searches

description: Manual scrape trigger endpoint works correctly
steps: Step 1: Make POST request to /api/scrape/trigger
Step 2: Verify response indicates scrape started or completed
Step 3: Verify new data appears in database with recent timestamps
Step 4: Verify scraped data has 'data_source' = 'real_scrape'

description: Scraper status endpoint returns current scraper state
steps: Step 1: Make GET request to /api/scrape/status
Step 2: Verify response contains 'status' field (idle/running/error)
Step 3: Verify response contains 'last_scrape' timestamp
Step 4: Verify response contains 'events_count' per sport

description: APScheduler runs auto-refresh every 15 minutes
steps: Step 1: Start backend server
Step 2: Verify APScheduler is configured with 15-minute interval
Step 3: Check scheduler job list contains scrape job
Step 4: Verify initial scrape runs on startup
Step 5: Verify data freshness after waiting (or by checking scheduler)

description: Events API returns list of all scraped events
steps: Step 1: Ensure database has scraped events
Step 2: Make GET request to /api/events
Step 3: Verify response is an array of event objects
Step 4: Verify each event has required fields: id, sport, event_name, scraped_at
Step 5: Verify events are from real scrape (data_source = 'real_scrape')

description: Events API filters by sport parameter
steps: Step 1: Make GET request to /api/events?sport=football
Step 2: Verify all returned events have sport='football'
Step 3: Make GET request to /api/events?sport=tennis
Step 4: Verify all returned events have sport='tennis'

description: Single event API returns event with odds
steps: Step 1: Get an event ID from /api/events
Step 2: Make GET request to /api/events/:id
Step 3: Verify response contains event details
Step 4: Verify response contains odds array
Step 5: Verify odds have selection_name and back/lay odds

description: Live events API returns only live events
steps: Step 1: Make GET request to /api/events/live
Step 2: Verify all returned events have is_live=true or status='live'
Step 3: Verify response is an array (may be empty if no live events)

description: Sports API returns list of sports with event counts
steps: Step 1: Make GET request to /api/sports
Step 2: Verify response contains array of sport objects
Step 3: Verify each sport has 'name' and 'count' fields
Step 4: Verify counts match actual events in database

description: Place bet API creates bet record
steps: Step 1: Get a valid event_id and selection from /api/events
Step 2: Make POST request to /api/bets with bet details
Step 3: Verify response contains created bet with id
Step 4: Verify bet appears in /api/bets endpoint

description: Bet history API returns user bets
steps: Step 1: Create a bet via /api/bets POST
Step 2: Make GET request to /api/bets
Step 3: Verify response contains the created bet
Step 4: Verify bet has all required fields: stake, odds, status, created_at

description: Open bets API returns only open bets
steps: Step 1: Create a bet with status 'open'
Step 2: Make GET request to /api/bets/open
Step 3: Verify all returned bets have status='open'

description: AI chat endpoint sends message to Claude and returns real response
steps: Step 1: Ensure ANTHROPIC_API_KEY is set
Step 2: Make POST request to /api/ai/chat with message
Step 3: Verify response contains 'response' field with AI-generated content
Step 4: Verify response contains 'model' field starting with 'claude-'
Step 5: Verify response contains 'response_source' = 'claude_api'
Step 6: Verify response is NOT a template/mock response

description: AI chat returns error when API key is missing - no fallback
steps: Step 1: Remove or unset ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
Step 2: Make POST request to /api/ai/chat with message
Step 3: Verify response is HTTP 500 or error status
Step 4: Verify error message indicates API unavailable
Step 5: Verify NO template or mock response is returned

description: AI conversations list endpoint returns conversation history
steps: Step 1: Create a conversation via /api/ai/chat
Step 2: Make GET request to /api/ai/conversations
Step 3: Verify response contains list of conversations
Step 4: Verify each conversation has id and created_at

description: AI conversation detail endpoint returns full message history
steps: Step 1: Get conversation id from /api/ai/conversations
Step 2: Make GET request to /api/ai/conversations/:id
Step 3: Verify response contains messages array
Step 4: Verify messages have role, content, created_at
Step 5: Verify assistant messages have model_used and response_source='claude_api'

description: Database schema includes all required tables
steps: Step 1: Connect to SQLite database
Step 2: Verify scraped_events table exists with correct columns
Step 3: Verify scraped_odds table exists with correct columns
Step 4: Verify user_bets table exists with correct columns
Step 5: Verify ai_conversations table exists with correct columns
Step 6: Verify ai_messages table exists with correct columns

description: Database has data_source column always set to real_scrape
steps: Step 1: Query all records from scraped_events
Step 2: Verify every record has data_source='real_scrape'
Step 3: Verify no records have data_source='mock' or null

description: Fractional odds are correctly converted to decimal
steps: Step 1: Find odds with fractional format (e.g., '5/1')
Step 2: Verify decimal conversion is correct (5/1 = 6.00)
Step 3: Verify '1/4' converts to 1.25
Step 4: Verify 'EVS' or '1/1' converts to 2.00
